text: The Mueller report has been delivered to the attorney general
author: thomaskaplan

text: One question looming over the Pentagon's giant cloud-computing project: Would Trump allow his administration to award a $10 billion contract to Amazon?
author: thomaskaplan

text: The founder of a start-up called Burrp! is now at the center of a fight over a huge Pentagon contract. With @KYWeise: https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/20/technology/military-contract-deap-ubhi.html …
author: thomaskaplan

text: A second Senate hearing on aviation safety in the "near future" will include Boeing and others, per a notice on the Senate Commerce Committee website.
author: thomaskaplan

text:
After the two 737 Max crashes, the Senate Commerce aviation subcommittee will hold a hearing on airline safety on March 27. 

Expected to testify: the heads of the FAA and NTSB, as well as the DOT inspector general.
author: thomaskaplan

text: New: The FAA has released a notification to regulators in other countries providing an update on the 737 Max. It says its review of Boeing's software fix is an "agency priority."
author: thomaskaplan

text: The NTSB says it is sending three investigators to France to assist with the analysis of the black boxes from the Ethiopian Airlines jet.
author: thomaskaplan

text: FAA's Dan Elwell says on @GMA that the black boxes are now in France: "We hope to start getting initial data feeds from the boxes hopefully by the end of the day."
author: thomaskaplan

text: .@RepPeterDeFazio says he will seek communications between Boeing and the FAA: “We’re going to get anything in writing there is to get.”
author: thomaskaplan

text: NEW: The chairman of the House transportation committee says he will investigate how the FAA certified the 737 Max and is willing to use subpoena power https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/13/business/canada-737-max.html …
author: thomaskaplan

text:
Two key House Democrats, @RepPeterDeFazio and @RepRickLarsen, are now raising questions about the FAA's certification of the 737 Max.

More on that issue: https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/03/world/asia/lion-air-plane-crash-pilots.html …
author: thomaskaplan

text: NEW: In its order grounding the 737 Max, the FAA says there are "some similarities" between the Lion Air and Ethiopian Airlines crashes "that warrant further investigation of the possibility of a shared cause for the two incidents."
author: thomaskaplan

text: Breaking: Trump says the U.S. will ground the Boeing 737 Max 8 and 9
author: thomaskaplan

text: Here's our story: https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/13/business/canada-737-max.html …
author: thomaskaplan

text: Canada bans flights by the 737 Max, further isolating the FAA https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/13/business/canada-737-max.html …
author: thomaskaplan

text: New "satellite tracking data" suggests a "possible, although unproven, similarity in the flight profile of the Lion Air aircraft," the Canadian transport minister says.
author: thomaskaplan

text: Canada is grounding the 737 Max, citing “new information,” its transport minister says.
author: thomaskaplan

text: .@RepCohen says the 737 Max 8 should be grounded: "The FAA should be leading the world in aviation safety, not dragging its feet."
author: thomaskaplan

text: Another senator calls for the 737 Max 8 to be grounded
author: thomaskaplan

text: .@RepChrisCollins, who was Erie County executive when the Colgan Air crash occurred in 2009, calls for the 737 Max 8 to be grounded
author: thomaskaplan
